BNC User Reference Guide

<title>

title contains the full title of a work of any kind.
Declaration 
element title { attribute level { text }?, macro.phraseSeq }
Attributes
(In addition to global attributes)
level indicates the bibliographic level of this title.
Status: Optional
Values are:
a the title is an analytic title, rather than a monographic one.
Example
 <title
xmlns:xaira="http://www.xaira.org/ns/1.0/spec"
xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"
xmlns:rng="http://relaxng.org/ns/structure/1.0">Amnesty International meeting. Sample containing about 15274 words speech recorded in public context</title>
Example
 <bibl
xmlns:xaira="http://www.xaira.org/ns/1.0/spec"
xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"
xmlns:rng="http://relaxng.org/ns/structure/1.0">
  <title>An awfully big adventure. </title>
  <author n="BainbB1" domicile="England">Bainbridge, B</author>
  <imprint n="DUCKWO1">
   <publisher>Duckworth & Company Ltd</publisher>
   <pubPlace>London</pubPlace>
   <date value="1990">1990</date>
  </imprint>
  <pp>49-192</pp>
 </bibl>
; ;
Module core
